reason:
Tooltip uses Radix UI primitives requiring complex setup:
- React: Requires TooltipProvider + Tooltip + TooltipTrigger + TooltipContent composition (@radix-ui/react-tooltip)
- Vue: Requires TooltipProvider + TooltipRoot + TooltipTrigger + TooltipContent in slots (radix-vue)
- Both frameworks require portal rendering and asynchronous show/hide behavior
- Tests require user interaction simulation (hover, focus) with userEvent and waitFor
- Current test runner is designed for simple prop-based components (Badge, Card)
- Cannot test Radix UI behavior (triggers, delays, portals, positioning) with simple mount(Component, { children })
- Manual tests provide better coverage for Radix-specific behavior, interactions, and accessibility

manualTestCoverage.react: 21 tests covering basic rendering, tooltip display, styling, positioning, interactions, accessibility, and use cases
manualTestCoverage.vue: 19 tests covering rendering, styling, props, transitions, and positioning

md3ComplianceVerified.typography: MD3 Body Small (12px, weight 400, letter-spacing normal)
